docs.lead_paragraph: The state comptroller’s office said the medical center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars every week; it also criticized high administrative salaries.

headline.seo: Audit Finds SUNY Downstate in Dire Fiscal Straits
headline.main: Audit, Citing Mismanagement, Finds SUNY Downstate in Dire Fiscal Straits
headline.print_headline: Audit, Citing Mismanagement, Finds SUNY Downstate in Dire Fiscal Straits

docs.abstract: New York State comptroller's audit shows that as SUNY Downstate Medical Center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars weekly, 15 of the hospital's top administrators were paid taxpayer-financed salaries over $200,000; at same time, nearly 500 lower-paid employees were sent layoff notices.
docs.snippet: The state comptroller’s office said the medical center was hemorrhaging millions of dollars every week; it also criticized high administrative salaries.

docs.lead_paragraph: The UnitedHealth Group, the nation’s largest health insurer, said that revenue rose more than 11 percent in the fourth quarter, while net income slipped 1 percent.

docs.lead_paragraph: The appointment of Denis R. McDonough would continue President Obama’s practice of putting the people he trusts most in critical positions.

headline.seo: Denis McDonough to Become White House Chief of Staff
headline.main: Obama Plans to Name Close Aide on National Security as Chief of Staff
headline.print_headline: Obama Plans to Name Close Aide on National Security as Chief of Staff

docs.abstract: Pres Obama is planning to elevate key national security deputy Denis R McDonough to White House chief of staff, continuing Obama's practice of putting people he trusts most in critical positions.
docs.snippet: The appointment of Denis R. McDonough would continue President Obama’s practice of putting the people he trusts most in critical positions.

docs.lead_paragraph: The study was the first to look at segregation as a factor in lung cancer mortality, and its authors said they could not fully explain why it worsens the odds of survival for African-Americans.

headline.seo: Study Links Segregation and Lung Cancer Deaths in Blacks
headline.main: Segregation Linked in Study With Lung Cancer Deaths
headline.print_headline: Segregation Linked in Study With Lung Cancer Deaths

docs.abstract: Study in JAMA Surgery finds that African-Americans who live in highly segregated counties are more likely to die from lung cancer than those in counties that are less segregated.
docs.snippet: The study was the first to look at segregation as a factor in lung cancer mortality, and its authors said they could not fully explain why it worsens the odds of survival for African-Americans.
